Reviews.Title: “Superb rooms”
Reviews.Author: Remy_et_Karine
Reviews.Content: I am travelling to Paris for business. I am delighted to stay at the Oceania hotel. Service is good, small restaurant near the in-door swiming pool (glass) is coosy. The modern and large rooms are really superb. No noise. Very clean. Well equiped with nice TV and wifi. Access to La Defense with T2 tramway. Access to Paris with the metro. But no in a touristic area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beckfling
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and was very impressed, was very modern and the staff were very helpful. The breakfast was lovely, a great selection of french cuisine. The room was very nice but slightly small. There was free wii fi available too. Very close to a metro station which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but you can do better for less!”
Reviews.Author: Hypnotist
Reviews.Content: My experience; It's clean. Small rooms. Nice bathroom. Plenty of towels. No fridge in the room. Beds are comfy (I'm 6'3"), but those square pillows (what are they even for?) BBC1, 2 and 3 on the room TV. Sexy little pool, small but OK fitness room (Concept Rower, 2 each Bikes and Treadmills, free towels, apples and chilled water). Nice little bar. Rubbish room service (selection, quality, service and price all unacceptable). Generally friendly though. The location is OK if you have reason to be in this part of town. Tram is nearby, Metro is 300m away. Don't bother with the local restaurants; especially the Versailles opposite. The best sushi value is the New Tokyaki, 300 m away. Otherwise walk up to Porte de Versailles, but be ready for price shock (€10 a pint of lager). There's a corner shop ( turn left out the front door and walk about 300m) which sells decent fruit, wine & beer, and biscuits! But what about that strange rumbling noise all night, like the lower deck of a cruise ship??? Recommendation: there are two Mercure Hotels very nearby, both of which have much nicer rooms, and you can usually get the same or better online rate. Personally I prefer the Mercure Vaugirard Porte de Versailles which is right outside the metro and tram stop with loads of bars, restaurants, and a supermarket within metres. On some weeks you can even get the 5* Pullman Rive Gauche for a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Relativelly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Superann
Reviews.Content: Fairly new hotel, not far from metro, relativelly small rooms (I hit on the bed corner three times during one night stay), very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor should not be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting hotel, luxery suite 2 rooms + sitting area is actually 1 bedroom and 1 sofa bed totally unsuitable for 4 people, after an enormous dispute exchanged this for 2 standard rooms. The cost of these rooms are not cheap and they are very small. The bed is comfortable but no storage and also no tea and coffee facilities. You cannot get a coffee or tea until 4pm in the hotel (after a mediocre and expensive breakfast finishes at 10.30am). In room cinema on demand broken, ice machine on floor broken, ironing facilities (a room with 2 irons on timer) wiring faulty. Plus points is the location as very nice part of Paris but hotel should struggle to get 3 stars for this venue more hostel than hotel. Rooms as mentioned very small no mini bar or coffee facilities which is normally a universal standard. Worth looking for other hotels as pictures and reality flatter to deceive.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Surprise for a Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dana_christian
Reviews.Content: Knowing the typical Paris Hotels usually a trip to Paris is downsized by the low quality Hotels available in the city. Oceania Paris was a pleasant surprise! The room was clean and big enough, internet was working, breakfast was more then typical croissant and butter. Will surely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but off center and deceived by the spa”
Reviews.Author: natpointeshoes
Reviews.Content: Very small but comfortable rooms. Very good mattress. Nice bathroom but only on set of towels for two people. We were disappointed by the spa: the jacuzzi is integrated in the pool and therefore is not at a normal temperature for a jacuzzi (colder of course - even if the pool is a very nice temperature, it not warm enough to relax without swimming)... We went there for the jacuzzi (so you can imagine our deception)... Only two chairs to lie around the pool... Bathrobes normally only available for upper class rooms... The staff is very nice but the service is not always what it should: one of us had forgotten a toothbrush and was told to get down to the reception (in the services folder, it was mentioned that they would bring it to you). The hotel is a bit off center but not far from a metro station and the tram... There are snacks and drinks vendor machines in the lobby, which can be very handy... There is a nice brasserie just opposite the hotel "Le Versailles" with very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: worthonel
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Oceania and were so satisfied that we returned for a third night after traveling in sw France, before flying out. It's close to the metro which is very easy to navigate - was our first visit to Paris - the staff spoke English well, especially Enzo, and were helpful. The breakfast is very good and the massive showers in the rooms were one of the highlights. The hotel provides a quiet and welcoming base to explore Paris from and the restaurant across the road is highly recommended too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBarron
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great - room is small but very practical, the shower was excellent, great breakfast, all very clean. Staff was friendly. For a business trip - was above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Awonderfull stay, and trip.”
Reviews.Author: Tigerheart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Oceania Paris, i had a wonderfull stay at the hotel. The Hotel location is not far from shoping area and fast food resurants. The hotel is quiet and serve breakfast with good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MegB20101
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, nice location, very close to metro, easily accessible to the main attractions and very cheap to get around, close to shops and a market. Breakfast was lovely, swimming pool smallish but adequate, sauna /steamrooms were relaxing. All in all nice hotel with lovely rooms and would def recomment to a friend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom_hills
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect hotel. Very close to the metro and all tourist attractions a short ride away. Went to Disney for one day and was easy to get to approx an hour and a quarter journey. On arrival the staff were excellent. Spoke excellent English after my attempt to speak French. Breakfast and the room were amazing also. Room was fairly small but bathroom perfect, although it is small it was perfect for what we wanted. Nice to have a hotel we are happy to come back and chill in the evenings too. Spa was good although pool was on the chilly side. Towels provided in room and for spa in changing rooms. Breakfast was a big selection and good way to start the day. Shop around for a deal as this could be an expensive hotel. I managed £100 a night and we stayed for 2. Only downside is that there is no full restaurant. Bar does light snacks but not meals. Hwever near the metro there are a vast selection of restaurants which are much cheaper than eatig out in central Paris. Although it seems far out from the centre it was very easy and qcuik to get too by the metro!! Amazing hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nMatan
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. Rooms are clean and equipped great shower TV and bed. The only thing is that they are small (but I don’t think it’s a problem) Service is very good stuff is nice and helpful. Very nice breakfast The only problem is the location, if you want to reach the center you are 7 minutes walk from the metro and not in a walking distance from Paris I did come back, it's my second time and I will come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clare c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well thought out. The rooms are small, yes, but they have everything you need for a modern, extremely clean, 4 star stay. The breakfast was excellent, lots of choice. The metro is a 5 minute walk away and takes you to the heart of everything. When we arrived we were a bit concerned that the hotel faced a main road (dual carriageway on a bridge), but once inside you have no clue of that. I would definitely stay here again.. plus the pool & sauna adds a lovely bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but too small beds...”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol81 Posted by a Solfaktor traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is quite alright on the south side of the city with the metro station on a short walking distance. The staff is very friendly, English speaking and you even get to borrow an umbrella when it rains! The breakfast buffet is very nice too. Our room was modern and clean, however the nights were quite uncomfortable for me personally, since the length of the beds seemed to be only 1.90 and I'm measuring 1.94, which is tall but not unusual... I told the staff about this, but unfortunately they informed me that all beds in the hotel had the same size. Also did the cleaning lady not refill the shower gel, nor did she leave new cotton pads after our first morning, only until I left her a note on the 3rd day. General conclusion: a very pleasant hotel, and especially comfortable for people under 1.90m!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paz I
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, the pool is pretty awesome though smaller than we originally thought. The room was very nice and clean though the AC was pretty lousy. We had it turned on to full power and I was still to hot to fall asleep at night, talked to the front desk about it and they said they would sent someone to fix it while we were away. It did improve a bit but not enough for those hot paris nights. The breakfest buffet was lovely, if you stay here definatly take the breakfest (though avoind the scrambled egg...tasted pretty wierd). The location was a long way away from the main attractions in paris but close to metro station. With 1 change of line or more you can still get to anywhere in paris pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find”
Reviews.Author: ross b
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely clean, comfortable and conveniently located hotel. It is a short (5 mins) walk to the metro station, from which you can catch a train into the centre; this takes around 10/15 mins. There is also a tram just outside the hotel which goes directly to La Defense. Good pizzeria (L'oliver) 2 min walk from hotel. As for the hotel itself, it is very clean, comfortable and quiet at night. For breakfast there was a good range of food. Overall, I found the hotel to be a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Maggie557
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. The staff were very polite and helpful. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel has gym and spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Jen P
Reviews.Content: we stayed there July'10. it's 1 block away from the subway. getting around in Paris is really cheap. make sure to buy the tickets in bulk if you are riding the subway a lot because you will get a great discount. Our room at Hotel Oceania was very nice, clean, modern, quiet, and comfy. it's small but this is normal in Europe. bath was updated and clean. separate toilet, small but clean and has 2 flushes ( for #1 and #2) :) Pretty cool. free breakfast, which was lovely and a lot to choose from. sitting outside in the garden was cute for breakfast. staff was so nice. they would brew us fresh coffee though the coffee was not empty and we came to the end of the breakfast. they even set up the table outside with table cloth and everything though breakfast was technically over. pool and sauna were nice. we had a cheap room and called front desk for robes - they told us it's for the more expensive rooms, but still brought them for free in a second. we extended for one more day b/c we loved it so much. we were late for over an hour for check out, and front desk gave us a friendly reminder and told us not to rush. finally, when we checked out they offered to hold our bags for us. Oceania made our stay so pleasant. This is coming from a picky person, so if I liked it everyone has got to like it.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: Not much of a step up from a Formula 1. Good points: clean, quiet, and free wi-fi, but downsides: very hot and stuffy, airless rooms (and small); downmarket fixtures and fittings, rubbish toiletries, cramped breakfast area. There has to be better value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a great luxury hotel in a local area this is the place”
Reviews.Author: BenF1972
Reviews.Content: We booked this place because of the spa/pool facilities. We were very satisfied with the whole hotel and the staff. The room we had was a bit small but that is Paris. The theme of the hotel chain is water and relaxation and this is exactly what you get. The showers in the room were excellent and catered perfectly to this theme. I will defiantly stay here again and in any of their other hotels in France. The area is great if you want to be out of the touristy areas and feel like you are in Paris with a more French local surrounding. The location is a bit away from the major sights but the transport is excellent and you soon forget the distance you traveled to get to and from places. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice as it's new, clean and next to convenient means of transport. Don't hesitate to book even if it seems to be far away from the city centre. Contrary to the TINY ( you can't imagine how much! ) hotel rooms are in Paris, this hotel has plenty of space, free heated swimming pool and spa. Stay and enjoy some luxury at incredibly low price if you find the right time (they make great offers now and then).

Reviews.Title: “just not good, really”
Reviews.Author: ISmackedTheLion
Reviews.Content: Came here for 2 nights - and checked out after 1st one. On (late) arrival I was met by a friendly receptionist, was given room 317. Room is just too small, although poshy-looking. Bed is big (actually, takes too much of the room), bathroom (well, shower) is connected to the bedroom ("foggy" glass, see picture). Separate toilet is super-super tiny and dark. No space for bag, just a small open closet with few hangers. Flat TV, water next to the bed - and that's just it. Room is really too small if you plan to stay for longer. WiFi is free - but it doesn't work, it's just so frustrating. Doesn't work in the room, doesn't work in the patio. So, checked out after 1st night (receptionist wasn't even surprised!) and moved to (closer-to-work) Pullman, just 10EUR/night more expensive. Cannot recommend Oceania.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and ideal for Expo site”
Reviews.Author: npr1uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very handy for the Expo site which is next door and the metro and tram stop at Porte de Versailles. It is next to the tram line and under the flyover of a busy road but there was no noise in the rooms which were clean, modern and of a deent size. breakfast was good with a selection of pastries, ham, cheeses, fruit, bacon and eggs. An added bonus was free wi-fi in the rooms. The bar was expensive but probaly what you would expect of a hotel bar in a capital city. Quite a few restaurants, bars and a supermarket near the metro station and the sights of Paris about 15 minutes away by public transport. In fact it's probably easier to use public transport than get a cab due to the traffic and the fact that most of the drivers we had didn't seem to know where they were going! Excellent English spoken by many staff and the cost was 140 euros a night for a double room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ellas9602
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my beloved on a romantic break. Location is good, metro stop is just over the road. There are quite a few restaurants in the vicinity also. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Breakfast was very good, good coffee and pastries. Pool was a nice extra but I agree with other reviews that being watched from the bar is a bit weird. We walked into the centre most days. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Rooms, Close to local businesses”
Reviews.Author: HunEbun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a business trip in Feb 2011. Due to the location (Being so close to the conference/exhibition centres) this hotel books up very quickly, I have an upcoming stay at the hotel in March but for 2 business trips I have not been able to book the hotel because it is already full. The hotel is a very short distance from Port de Versailles metro station and if you take the correct exit from the metro station you can see the hotel directly in front of you. I was greated warmly on check-in and told about all the services on offer in the hotel. Had dinner in the hotel bar, a Ceasar Salad that was good on portion size but quite pricey. Bar was very ambient, staff were friendly and service was good. I was not asked if I wanted to charge the dinner to my room so I paid in cash. The pool looked lovely, I did not use it as I felt uncomfortable that you could be viewed from the bar when using the pool. Rooms were a good size with a very comfortable double bed. The shower facilities were great although my colleague had an issue with the water preasure. I liked that you could turn the shower head to change the streams of the shower from rain to jet to champagne like bubbles. Not much noise could be heard from the adjoining rooms. TV was good with BBC1, BBC2 and CBBC that turned into BBC3 at 7pm Had a problem with my WIFI access that was resolved when I went down to reception. Breakfast was a buffett style, again greated warmly by the staff, with hot and cold options - I particulary like the scrambled eggs. I really liked that there were water coolers near to the lifts on the floor that I was staying (3, not sure if these are on every floor) which also dispensed Ice. it was good to take a fresh cup back to my room in the evening (be careful if you have ice in your cup overnight as I noticed that my cup would leak overnight) Had quite a few issues with my card key not working the first time, I had to swipe several times before the door would work (not easy when you are carrying a laptop, handbag and a cup of water. Once I had to go to reception to get a new card key (great service again) but this card key had the same issue so I assume it was the lock. Took a 1.2km walk to and from work each day through Suzanne Legrand Parc to rue Camille Desmoulins, although you can use the tram (3 stops) that is a short walk from the hotel. Local restaurants include L'Olivier which is a wonderful Italian restaurant just around the coner. Overall a good hotel and I will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Issues.”
Reviews.Author: CTMEMANY
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay 2 nights out of our 10 night stay a bit more outside of Paris. We found Porte de Versailles lovely with a friendly town. There was a hotel bar that was open and a swimming pool which is a definite plus. Upon our arrival we checked and in took a nap. Much to my surprise I found the bed had tiny moths all over it and me. I called front desk and housekeeping promptly arrived. They spoke only in French which I understand but do not really speak well. When asked in English they said everything was fine. Which is not what they were discussing in French. They changed the sheets and the towels told us it would be fine now. We took their word for it and everything was fine the moths did not return. The only problem is the housekeeping staff would check on us so often they would ignore the privacy Do Not Disturb signs. They let themselves in daily at least 3 times before 12pm noon!!!!! Not much privacy on our honeymoon here!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, easily accessible hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: emileelouise92
Reviews.Content: I didn't really have any faults with the hotel. Check-In was quick and easy. We went in the pool which was nice and a farely adequate size. However, everyone sat at the bar can see which we both felt was a bit weird. Not far from the metro station uses metro line 12, easyily accessible once the metros mastered! Only complaint I would have is breakfast :-/ Not down to choice or anything but not to my tastes anyway. The rooms are an adequate size due to the amount of time spent in them which isn't much and the bathrooms were very clean. On cleanliness the maids were out each morning and let on. I enjoyed my stay at the oceania and would recommend to anyone :-)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is definitely not a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kostoula1981
Reviews.Content: I was in the hotel from April 6 until April 11_ 2010 as a part of a group. Total 6 nights – 7 days. Hotel is very far away from the centre of Paris. The metro station “Porte de Versailles” is 3-4 minutes walk from the hotel, it is good and fast but you have to change one or two lines to arrive to the center. The underground is well connected to public transport. You can also use a taxi, it is not so expensive some 12 - 14 euro to the downtown. Be careful for your personal things everywhere in Paris, especially in metro. The Cleaning condition was bad. The cleaning man fixed our room everyday after 3 pm., without letting enough towels for us, we were two persons in the same room. We had to fight with the “cleaning manager” because we needed two sets towels and they gave us everyday only one. They had never changed the small towel from the shower. We hadn’t soap, shampoo, or lotion, like the standards of other hotels. We hadn’t mini bar to our room. There was only a corridor machine for free water or ice. You could hear the noise of metro when we were in the room. The bed sheets had not been changed, during our sixth staying. The buffet breakfast was conveniently timed with a large choice of food, very nicely prepared. Breakfast was good. The reception staff is helpful and speak English. This hotel is definitely not a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, far away from the center”
Reviews.Author: villamoretti
Reviews.Content: I was in the hotel in April as a part of a large group with my mother and daughter. As I have no possibility to choose the hotel it made our agency. Hotel is very far away from the centre of the Paris and sight you want to see when you come there. Of course there is a metro which is good and fast but you have to change one or two to arrive to the center. So it is not convinient for older people or families with young children. The surrounding is not interesting at all and you can not feel the heart of Paris. Room we have got was quite big for our three, two bathrooms and separated toilet. Cleaning was more or less done, although one day in retard, after 3 pm. Strange standards with towels not enough for us three. It was very hot in the room during the night and only what air con was producing was noise- so desperatly hot and no chance to open the window because of the noise from the large road crowded with cars going all the day and night. So if you go there ask for the courtyard room. Breakfast itself was good but take care of your bags one lady remained without it - money and all cards ( anyway watch your bags everywhere in Paris, especially in metro). Taxi is not so expensive some 15 - 25 Eur to the center of the town but if you intend to use it several times a day than you can take hotel closer to the center which I suggest to all of the visitors who come like tourists and not for bussines.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not clean”
Reviews.Author: Paris0210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not a four star. The bed sheets had not been changed. The bed had been made but the sheets had clearly not been changed. The staff gave us new sheets and asked us to change the bed ourselves as housekeeping had finished for the day. Overpowering smell of cheap airfreshner in the room and everywhere in the hotel. Bar is strangely overlooking pool - as a result there was a strong smell of chlorine in the bar. It was a bit like staying in gym. I wouldn't recommend this place at all - totally overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lovely, Staff less than professional”
Reviews.Author: jimboEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights to celebrate a special birthday. The room was lovely with a large bed, huge walk-in shower area and seperate toilet. It was very clean with lovely areas to sit and relax including the pretty garden at the rear. The buffet breakfast was conveniently timed with a large choice of food, very nicely prepared. The biggest problem was the unavailability of a hot drink in the hotel except at breakfast. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room and, during our stay, both the hot and cold drink vending machines in the hotel foyer were out of order-suprise suprise. Therefore, to get a hot or cold drink, it was necessary to go to the extremely overpriced bar where the tiniest cup of coffee was four euros. I am also a smoker so duly asked about the smoking area as advised to do in the hotel information book in the room. I was then treated to a lecture by the less than professional receptionist about the dire consequences of smoking inside anywhere in France. I had absolutely no intention of smoking inside anymore than I do at home. I also asked one of the receptionists whether the trams went into Paris. The answer I got was a flat "no" with no follow up options as to how to get there. Most of the staff were friendly but I found them extremely unhelpful and a couple of the receptionists less than professional in there attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodview123
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for an engagement surprise break. Very clean and modern, no faults really; rooms ultra modern with large wet room, breakfast was good, nice pool and steam room, free wifi. Only negative would be laminate flooring which is noisy if the room above drop things on the floor !. Thanks to previous comments about italian restaurant almost next door, very good quality and value, busy each night which was a good sign for quality. Definitely buy a book of 10 tickets for the metro/bus/train these are good value at €11.60 for a book. It took just about 1hr 15mins to get from CDG to the hotel via train and tram. Which are ultra efficient and trams arrive every 3-4 mins ! There is a short walk from the hotel to the subway / tram stop about 500yds

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel quite a distance from the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: map9189
Reviews.Content: I was looking into a nice hotel for my boyfriend and I to stay at for Valentine's day weekend and based on the reviews and pictures it seemed perfect. However, we arrived from London by Chunnel- Gard due Nord (the station) being on the complete other side of the city was not something we had anticipated. A 50 euro taxi we arrived to discover that the room we had requested was now occupied. After a few minutes the staff managed to "find it". We learned the metro which is up the street from the hotel, but going anywhere did prove to be a hassle. This hotel is not for you if you are trying to get the full experience, but the rooms are very nice. The standard room doesn't have a bathtub, which I do not like but the shower is very modern and nice. All and all a nice weekend and thankful that we had already visited the city before and didn't need to pack in sites because the location would not have allowed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business, decent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: darcherd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oceania on a business trip - the location was an easy walk to our company office; it is a good location for the Conference Center and many international corporate headquarters. It is not a great location for tourists - if you're looking for something in the heart of old Paris, this is not it. The rooms are small but functional and very nicely appointed in a clean, modern style and the bathrooms are particularly nice with a generous walk-in shower and a separate water closet for the toilet. The staff was very helpful and nearly all spoke English to one degree or another. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. My only complaints were difficulty in connecting to my corporate VPN through there in-room internet service (though the general connection was fine with adequate bandwidth) and the exercise room which was quite overheated. But on balance I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is doing business on the southwest side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel but gym and pool a let down”
Reviews.Author: linkmail
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oceania for a recent exhibition at the nearby Expo so top marks for the location. The rooms are small but comfortable, and there's now free wi-fi which was a bonus (when it worked!). However my plan to have a leisurely spare day lazing around the pool was quickly abandoned. The pool itself is tiny and the water on the cool side. Five strokes from end to end - all within full view of everyone at the bar. The jacuzzi was the same temperature as the pool, so not much point there. The gym was sparsely equipped with just one big TV showing some French TV station. And the much hyped steam rooms.... well I've seen more steam in an episode of the Waltons! I went in, waited around for something to start, and then after about 10 minutes gave up. So much for the recent refurbishment.. Having selected the hotel specifically for the leisure facilities it was a major disappointment. Must do better... So, in summary: good place to stay if you get a cheap rate and need to visit an exhibition or trade show. Don't pay top rates expecting wonderful gym and spa facilities though. They're not much good.

Reviews.Title: “There are better values in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dallas808
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here on a business trip. The prevailing rates (during the Paris Fashion Week) was ~280 euro/night and was knocked down to ~135/night due to my client corporate rate so guess it was quite a "good value". However, I would likely opt for other 4* choices on personal trips for a number of reasons: 1. The housekeeping service was either excessive or completely missing. On first day, they woke me up @ 10am despite my DND sign on the door. On another, they skipped cleaning my room all together (no DND sign). When I made a request @ 5pm, they told me I had to wait until tomorrow. The next afternoon, I left my room service items outside and had to called them to pick out twice. Expectedly, nobody came. 2. The broadband internet was spotty - slow with frequent dropped connections. Skype or VOIP voice calls were difficult at best. I ended up taking my laptop to a nearby cafe to get some works done. 3. While the hotel is a short walk from a Metro station (Line 12), visiting popular destinations in Paris (e.g. Louvre) is often a 35-45 minutes "hassle".

Reviews.Title: “A beautifully implemented aquatic theme”
Reviews.Author: Kanaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a double room. Highlights of the hotel include the cool milky glass wall separating the bathroom from the main room and the large windows at the bar with views of the pool - all in keeping with the aquatic theme of the hotel. The area is very quiet. Only negative of significance would be that the rooms were on the small side - there was barely enough space to pull the chair from under the desk. All in all, however, a delightful stay at this stylish, friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel well situated!”
Reviews.Author: Nanamei
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania is a great hotel with a good restaurant, spa possibilities and a very good service for any request you may have. A minus is concerning the wireless internet connection that does not work everywhere in the hotel (was not working in my room).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Tinko29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a long weekend/romantic break, and the hotel was perfect. When you get to the metro station make sure you exit from exit 2, and it is a straight road (1 or 2min walk) to the hotel, you cant miss it. The rooms (as most people have said) are quite small, but they are well decorated and the bathrooms are a decent size. The buffet breakfast was an excellent way to start the day, and the staff are really friendly. The swimming pool, isn't really for lengths but is v. good for cooling down after a hard day sightseeing! The restaurants around the hotel weren't brilliant, but it takes (about) 15mins to hit the centre of paris and all the cafes/bars etc. I'd recommend going around the Sorbonne at night, as there are some lovely wine bars and a really nice chinese restaurant nearby that locals go to...i think it is called, La Mer de Chine.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice hotel but not convenient to the places we wanted to see.”
Reviews.Author: nana444
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice with good amenities. The room was pleasant with a nice bathroom/shower. However, even with the great subways and trams in Paris, we felt the hotel was not conveniently located. Next time we will select a hotel that is closer to the things we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: Ian-Bristol
Reviews.Content: Not immediately obvious to find! - when you come out of Porte de Versailles metro look across road towards tram line and big exhibition centres - you see a road at right angles to the main road with an overhead walkway linking exhibition halls on the road that runs down towards a flyover - hotel is 5 min walk down by the flyover on the right. It is a bit out of town but plenty of nearby places to eat / drink / buy food nearby. Metro service - about 15 mins into centre of Paris - longest wait was 8 mins Despite the location the hotel seemed largely soundproofed from road noise. You could hear the metro rumbling underneath frequently though not that bad. Yes soundproofed from the outside world but not from inside so you got the usual door slamming and furniture dragging on laminate flooring 24/7 (why oh why do people do this..) Leisure pool and and a few exercise machines on floor -1 Clean and locker has towel in Reception staff very efficent and spoke good english. Check in/out done with minimum of fuss Room a bit on the small size but very clean and good quality bed / bedding. Good efficent shower (no bath) and separate toilet. Air conditioning worked well - on the lowest setting it was ok to sleep with though if you used the toilet it went onto full blast for about 10 minutes. Flatscreen TV on wall with about 40 free channels in major european languages . There is wireless internet access in the hotel. You get 15 min / day free after that it costs hotel rates (ie pricey if not on company expense account). To get the access initially you put your mobile phone no (including international code) into browser then you get a txt message back with a password and your user id (the mobile no with int code on front) Repeat this procedure daily. You could probably use your partner's mobile to get another 15 mins but this was not tested. (Given that it is a four star hotel a lack of free access seemed rather mean.) If you want free internet - there is a McDonalds with wifi about 5 mins walk down the road. Didn't have food / drink at the hotel - this looked pricey but as I said there are plenty of places to eat within a 5-10 min walk. Two electric sockets on desk and one hidden under neath desk. No fridge to keep drinks cool but there is an ice-making machine near the lifts so good to make an emergency "fridge" to keep milk fresh. No kettle in room so take travel kettle. Pets allowed (extra) Parking in underground car park (level -2) not free. Don't expect any free on street parking nearby - check regulations the parking wardens were out regularly (even early and late)

Reviews.Title: “Wow, absolutely amazing hotel !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ILOOOOVEHOLIDAYS
Reviews.Content: Rooms nice, very very modern, bathroom lovely, pool, bar, breakfast, staff everything brill. My only complaint would be the prices in the bar!! It cost about £12 for a beer and £15 for a cocktail :( A bit steep don't you think! On our way out at check out we realise there was a vending machine in the reception area which sells beers etc for around £4. Oh well that’s our fault we should have been more observant! Parking was reasonable at £20 Euros for a 2 night stay, not bad in a safe secure car park in the middle of a capital city. The metro tube station was 2 min walk and looks like they are building a tram, metro great service taking you anywhere you want to go in Paris. Paris itself was much more expensive than expected for food and drink, more expensive that London and watch out for the motorists ha ha they drive around like mad even the buses beeping there horns every two seconds! All in all a fantastic break, hotel perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minutes”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Miah
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife would like to express the wonderful experience we had during our stay in Oceania Paris Porte De Versailles in Paris France. We went during Valentines’ weekend and probably it was the perfect time to decide. The Accommodation at 1st felt it was too far away, pictures in the review were much different and wrong hotel, however when we arrived the hotel looked fantastic, staff were nice and the service was brilliant. The room was really high class and it had everything we as a couple wanted during our stay. The food was really nice in the café downstairs; we enjoyed our swimming and Jacuzzi together. It was also very good and relaxing - we had a good time. I couldn’t of asked for a better accommodation with the product and services provided was 1st class and of course not to forget the lovely sightseeing around Paris was absolute romantic. Brilliant I recommend everyone to try and visit Paris if you haven’t done so and probably choose this accommodation for your stay without a hesitation!!!!!!!!!!!!! Mr & Mrs Miah.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel facilities and service very good, however the bar and food is overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: mconnarty
Reviews.Content: We came for a short break in Paris and decided based on the user reviews on here to stay here. The service was very good with Bilingual staff happy to help, the room was clean and modern and was kept clean. Location wise it is about a 2-3 minute walk to the Metro, and then a further 10 minute ride to the centre of Paris. If i would change anything it would have to be the price of breakfast (17E each) and the prices of the bar (9E for a pint of beer); they are so expensive they really shoot themselves in the foot, we would have been happy to have been able to enjoy a drink in the bar in the evenings and have breakfast in the mornings but only if the prices were half of what they were. Finally, the room could have benefited from more than the one-double european power socket, as well as an ironing board or press.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Couldnt ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: denise1609
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Oceania in Paris for our Honeymoon in July. From the moment we arrived I knew it was going to be a brilliant holiday! The Hotel was spotless and the small details such as flowers on the tables just made it extra special. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times even though we did not speak any French we were still able to communicate well with the staff! The room was perfect, great views of the hotel garden from our window and it was cleaned everyday, although one problem was the cleaners coming round early on some days, however this is solved by clicking the privacy switch on your door which stops them entering using there key card so it was not a problem! Breakfast again was brilliant, so much choice and hot food too which is a bonus in Paris! We used the pool everyday and there was never more than about 4 people in it at once so we were able to just relax in the Jacuzzi! There was also a sauna room one for males and one for females which was a downside as I didn’t want to sit in there on my own but the staff and guests didn’t seem to mind if couples wanted to go in the men’s together as we saw many couples doing this. There was also a fitness room and massage parlor. The location of the hotel couldn’t have been better, although there were no views of Paris itself as it’s slightly outside the centre the metro is only a 2 minute walk down the road and will take you to the Eiffel tower in around 10mins so it was perfect. Also on several nights we had got back to the hotel and didn’t fancy going back into Paris centre for dinner as it gets quite busy but this was fine as there was plenty of restaurants to choose from around the corner from the hotel including Italian, Chinese, Indian takeaway pizzas. The Italian place has amazing food (L'Olivier) and is relatively cheap compared to other restaurants in Paris. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DaveBarryW
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only metres from the Porte de Versailles metro but make sure you exit from Sortie 2 for shortest route to the hotel. Very clean hotel and staff very friendly. Self service breakfast had lots to choose from and all good quality food. Plenty of staff around to help and nice to sit outside in the courtyard. Swimming pool looked good but not big enough to exercise in. Fitness area looked ok and had some aerobic equipment but not enough for serious work out. I would definitely stay there again as area is out of main tourist spots so restautrants around were reasonably good and not too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Excellent valus and service”
Reviews.Author: Chris1963-10
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The service was also very good, for example, we forget our telephone charger and the hotel staff found one for us. Also our room was very good, as was the pool facilities - really enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot away from the hustle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: travelguru54
Reviews.Content: The Oceania is located in a nice area on the southside of Paris, well away from the touristy. It's just a couple hundred yards from the #12 metro line which will connect you with all parts of the city. There are quite a few good resturants and small shops near by to the north and south of the hotel within walking distance. If you want to sit down for breakfast, the 17E price per person is not out of line with what you will pay at most sidewalk cafe's, and the selection is much better. Stand up or take away alternatives for cheaper breakfast options are abundant near the hotel. The rooms are really small, but managable for a couple (a family will need more than one room), but the common areas are spacious and really nice. The courtyard is great, and the health/pool facilities are outstanding. Consult your map, and take a walk through a great little neighborhood heading north toward the Invalides/Eiffel tower. It's Paris at it's best away from the crowds. You'll experience Paris much differently than the masses. Oceania is a nice find. Book early for a decent rate...the rack rates are steep.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dea_botica
Reviews.Content: Oh Paris is amazing city to visit...almost all the time i was out so..the hotel wasn't very important to me...but it is really nice hotel...room were bit small but very beutiful designed with great bit bathroom in spa style...love it..

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Elhawi
Reviews.Content: being locked into poolarea!! And subsequenty being told that other people watch the time. How is that possible in the steamroom and ladies changing room when there is no clock around?!! Even talking to the manager only resulted in a " sorry, the person closing has to check..." It truely did ruine my birthday weekend trip! The cleaning lady also has absolutely no respect, for privacy! If she wants to clean the room she´ll come knocking on your door every 10 minutes even though, the privacy button was pressed.... Not a nice experience at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overshadowed by unfriendly, discourteous, service”
Reviews.Author: chrizz419
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked this hotel after reading several pleasant reviews from TripAdvisor members. We stayed in a very nice standard room (which was above average size by Paris standards). The room and lobby was kept clean, there was a swimming pool that stayed opened late, and the hotel was only a few blocks away from the metro station. Unfortunately, these pleasantries were overshadowed by the awful service from the front desk staff and concierge. When we went to the front desk to check in or for help, the staff never welcomed us with a hello, much less a smile. Upon arriving, we asked to change our room from the first floor to a higher level room, and the front desk staff simply replied by stating that there were no other rooms with a queen size bed avaliable; though the hotel hardly seemed full to capacity. When we had trouble connecting to the internet we called the front desk; the staff stated that he could not help us and became agitated. I was insistent and he was then able to help. It seemed like he just did not want to be bothered! To add to the awful service, the conceriege was comedically inept. He could not answer simple questions about rental car companies or restaurants and when asked about day trips he simply handed us a pamphlet with little explanation and no added help. It was like he was a robot programmed by the Oceania Hotel. Our stay in Paris was part of a European tour in which we stayed in 7 different cities and at 7 different hotels. The service at the Oceania was surprisingly far and away the worst!!! The hotel is good, but the service was miserable; I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, modern, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiseOwl72
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in this hotel. It is a clean, modern hotel very close to a metro station (line 12). It takes about 15 minutes to the centre of Paris The hotel is run very efficiently, our package included breakfast which was very good. There were no tea/coffee making facilities or fridge in the room, but we had an ice machine on our landing The drinks in the bar were very expensive as was bottled water (5 euros for water which cost 0.64 euros in the shop down the road) If you are sightseeing in Paris do watch scams involving lost rings or bracelets, the items shown are brass, and are deliberately dropped on the pavement. Also watch out for pickpockets, especially around the Eiffel Tower and The Louvre

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: bignige
Reviews.Content: Stayed at he Hotel for a city break in Paris. Location of Hotel is just a few hundred yards from the Port de Versailles Metro Station which is on line 12 which puts you within one change of all the major attractions so very handy in that respect. It's about 30mins from Gare du Nord. A very warm welcome when we arrived and teh check in guy couldn't have been more helpful. The rooms were far superior to what we expected. Very spacious, especially the shower room and a separate toilet. Bed felt brand new and everything was clean and tidy. In room safe was also included. One downside was that there was no in room tea/coffee making facilities so if you wanted a cup of coffee first thing in the morning you had to go down to the vending machines in reception. A flat screen TV was available showing a large range of channels including all the BBC channels. Breakfast was included in our tariff and it was very good. It's buffet style but you had a good choice of continental and hot foods with unlimited coffee and tea if needed. There's no restaurant in the hotel but that isn't a problem as just around teh corner was a large choice of Chinese, Japanese, Italian and French places to eat. I would recommend the Italian, L'Olivier. Drinks in the hotel are expensive but there is a very nice cafe/bar across the road which is cheaper. Hotel was very quiet with no road noise considering it's opposite the Boulevard Peripherique. I would highly recommend this hotel for a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price but extremely bad service”
Reviews.Author: leungkinwah
Reviews.Content: Fair price but extremely bad service. Most of the staff were rude and not friendly! Never say morning or hello when you meet any staff. Breakfast was very bad. 4 to 5 stars hotel cost but 1 to 2 stars quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facilities, Pool and Breakfast and well priced!”
Reviews.Author: LetYourselfGo_09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oceania in June 2009 for a weekend and must say we were VERY happy with our choice of hotel and stay. I have stayed in Paris before with work and each time I have had a ‘boutique’ hotel as they call them which is by British standards a high-class guest house feel which is not to everyone’s taste. The Oceania on the other hand is a nice change and has a Marriot/Holiday Inn feel but on a smaller scale…a place where everything is modern, clean and comfortable. ARRIVAL - On arrival at the nearest Metro station (M12 - Porte de Versailles), exit the Metro and then get your bearings….you will see a tall MERCURE hotel on one side of the street. Now to avoid any confusion….the road that takes you to the Oceania hotel is directly OPPOSITE the Mercure hotel…a reasonably long road with what appears to be a bridge half way down the street. Follow this road and you will arrive at the Oceania….you cannot miss it. On entering the hotel you have a nice check-in desk with three individual desks on your left with very pleasant and helpful staff. On the right as you enter there is probably 6 or 7 chairs/sofas for you to relax and wait for a taxi or read a paper. Next to the sofas there are 3-4 vending machines serving a range of food, snacks and drinks (soft and alcoholic). Opposite the chairs there are three lifts all well presented and clean taking you to your floors…there are 6 floors in the hotel. On entering our room we were pleased that it was clean and modern with a nice sized bed. There is a separate toilet as you enter with a small sink….then as you walk into the room further there is a bed on the one side facing a 22” wall-mounted LCD TV with desk and chair. There is a very modern wet-room also in the main room (see the pics to get the idea) which has a rain-shower and long washbasin with mirrors. I must say that all the bathroom fittings were quality and the moulded basin etc was made from the high-end Corian material (good stuff if you are into your kitchens or bathroom fittings!). One good point to note is that our room had a window that actually opened fully…really good when the room gets a bit warm, and unlike the UK where health and safety means you can only open your window an inch in most hotels! Aircon unit was also in the room as is Wi-Fi available for 10Euro per day. Now to the facilities… BAR AREA – this is in the basement (-1) level and is very modern club/bar feel. No actual windows but feels very clean with lots of soft-changing LED lighting giving a very fresh and funky feel. The place gets you in the mood for a drink until you see the prices of the drinks themselves. Cocktails around 10-15Euros and Beers around 8-10 Euros. Not the place to spend the night, but nice atmosphere all the same, and drinks served with some nibbles. The bar area overlooks the pool too with floor to ceiling glass making. POOL/GYM AREA – this is a lovely addition to a Paris hotel. The gym is basic with a handful of essential training equipment, but nice all the same if you want to do a quick run or workout. The pool again feels new and modern with a perfectly sized pool area with Jacuzzi in the one corner. As you enter the pool you have women’s and men’s changing rooms and a room for massage if you choose to take one. On entering the changing rooms, Iike the rest of the hotel, you feel that all the fixtures and fittings are quality. Lots of rolled up towels to help yourself and a few showers. At the end of the changing room is a steam room (Hammam) which is quite large and a nice touch (note male and female changing rooms have their own steam room – there is not a mixed steam room). Open up your locker and you will find a towel and slippers already in the locker – nice touch. We enjoyed the leisure facilities and in particular the pool has in two corners of the pool very forceful jets coming from the floor and side….perfect for standing on and giving your feet a good blast back into life after walking the streets of Paris. It really did help you to unwind at the end of your day. To access the pool and gym area, you need to swipe your room card to get access to the area. BREAKFAST – we booked on a bed & breakfast basis and must say that we were pleasantly surprised by the ample buffet breakfast in the morning. They seem to cater for most tastes and requirements! First off a basket of fresh Danish pastries, croissants and pain-au-choclat. Next there were a few different cereals. A very large bowl of fresh mixed fruit was next to this with various yogurts to choose from. Next to this there were bread and toaster for your toast! Next to this a bowl of fresh fruit of apples, bananas, pears to eat (or take away!). Over the other side there were a selection of juices to help yourself to….and a few dishes of hot food….scrambled egg, German looking sausages, streaky bacon and grilled tomatoes. Finally a plate of meats and cheese. There was essentially something for everyone.….and now for my favourite bit as I’m a coffee lover. They had two proper coffee making machines (bean-to-cup) where you can help yourself to a FRESH cup of coffee. I travel with my work and in my experience so many good hotels serve poor coffee in the morning that often tastes burnt! Not at the Oceania…you can take a fresh coffee as you like it…from Espresso to Cappuccino and everything in between! For the tea lover, they have a basket of different teas to choose from and a hot water function to fill; up your teapot. In summary, we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay at the Oceania. For the money we paid and the facilities at this hotel, we felt it was exceptional value at £120/night (we booked via www.Octopustravel.com).

Reviews.Title: “Stress from the staff”
Reviews.Author: estee36
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my holiday to Paris and felt that overall my holiday was brilliant and the real let down was the hotel that me and my friend stayed at. On the first day we ordered room service and the food was awful! We also bought the internet package for 20 Euros, however after an hour or so the internet froze and we couldn't use the t.v... the woman at the reception said we had to wait until tomorrow for it to be fixed. After it got fixed, it happened on another occasion and then the technician found a faulty wire in the t.v, The hassle could have been avoided if the staff checked their t.v's more than once in a while! One other problem was the cleaning staff disturbing us at 9 o'clock in the morning... no-one wants to wake up early on holiday?! One morning my friend had vomited on the bed after a night out and the cleaners failed to remove all the dirty/stained sheets (it might have looked clean, but underneath the duvet it wasn't!) and after ringing reception numerous times and managing to get hold of the manager, he for some strange reason was in denial about the dirty sheets! My friend lost her temper in the end and after arguing with him he sent up a middle-aged man to change it. Oh and the movies on demand don't play, but you get charged for them... we managed to resolve that situation. At the end of our holidaywe didn't even get a proper goodbye? Oh well, atleast we know that this 4 star hotel has major flaws!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jcbpink
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, nice hotel. The staff are a bit hard to communicate with though as they didn't understand a thing we were saying most of the time, the cleaner kept on coming into our room every morning at 8.30am when we were sleeping and would get very annoyed when told to return later. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on thet. The hotel is a quiet village south of main paris it is quiet easy to get to all attractions from here though via the metro. the only warning i have is that paris is very EXPENSIVE!!!! a big mac and happy meal cost us 14 quros when it would only cost about £6 here so everything is double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles55
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for the New Year. We found the hotel was easy to find from Gare du Nord station. Once at the Port de Versailles metro stop, you can see the hotel in distance, about a 5 minute walk. Hotel very clean and comfortable, although rooms were a bit small, but this didn't bother us. English TV too. Breakfast was good; included hot food such a bacon and egg. We didn't use the swimming pool, although it looked lovely. Great value for money hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steven_way
Reviews.Content: Booked a package through Eurostar, a nice modern hotel near the peripeherique, 5 mins walk to the metro and then 15 mins into the centre of Paris. In the centre of conference / tradeshow town so could be busy. A good room, clean and tidy and attentive staff. A check in problem was expertly and politely solved. bar expensive and you are better off taking breakfast in a local bar than the hotel (15 euro buffet anyone?). Recommended for a long weekend, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Nikky14
Reviews.Content: After spending a lot of time going through hotels/reviews on tripadvisor, I finally settled on this hotel and I’m so glad I did! This hotel is fantastic! I’m quite fussy when it comes to hotels but this one ticks all the right boxes. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are nicely decorated. We were in Paris for our second wedding anniversary and the room we had was very nice, relatively spacious with nice bathroom and a separate toilet. Pros: Very nice/modern hotel Clean hotel/room Friendly Reception Staff This hotel is NOT in the middle of nowhere! Less than 5 minutes from train station (Port de Versailles) and 10mins to the centre of Paris. Loads of restaurants across the road from Port de Versailles station. VERY nice breakfast room. Good quality buffet breakfast. From the entrance of the hotel, turn right to the side street and within 5 minutes of walking, you will find at least 4 pizza restaurants, Chinese restaurant, 2 pharmacies, 2 mini supermarkets. Further along, there is McDonalds, KFC and more Italian restaurants. Cons: Absolutely Nothing! I WOULD definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ZuzanaCzech
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews we expected a pleasant stay. Our stay however turned into a big disappointment. The hotel standards do not really meet 4 start hotel. There was not a minibar in the room. The air-conditioning was not working properly, so it was very hot in the room. The hotel does not have a restaurant and there is not a room service in the evening. Moreover, dressing gown disappeared from the room after the first day. The bathroom necesaries were not supplemented (shower caps, etc.). The hotel also asked to charge for our stay already in the middle of our stay, which was really radiculous. The only advantage of this hotel is the location close to the exhibition halls, however, for the services it is offering, it is far too overpriced. We would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcdamo
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and is perfect if you want to visit the Exhibition centre as it's walking distance. We stayed to visit the Paris Motor Show. The hotel had very helpful and friendly staff. Had a choice of three pizza restaurants over the road, although not much else close by. The hotel has a pool and jacuzzi, although didn't have time to use them. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: student_trip_goer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is although stylish and very modern, although it does lack a parisian feel. The room was of a good size, we opted for the comfort double room. The shower was powerful and has the option of a hand held shower head or an over head rain style. There was a seperate toliet room with sink. The room has wifi, which is not too expensive and a selection of channels from various countries; including BBC 1 and 2. The rooms, as you'd expect from a four star hotel were cleaned everyday and to a high standard. We arrived at 11 o'clock in the morning and although check-in was at 2 due to us e-mailing ahead we we're allowed to get our room key straight away. The staff at the desk were friendly and spoke excellent English. The bar was expensive and we only went there once. The cocktails despite being expensive were very nice and although there is not a restaurant at this hotel they serve a selection of snacks. The large terrace is beautiful and well looked after. It is permitted to take your own drinks bought from a local shop and food onto the terrace, which a lot of people staying at the hotel took advantage of. There are also a couple of vending machines in reception, containing a selection of snacks and sandwiches. These vending machines were cheaper than the shops around the corner. The pool and gym were perfect and something that is hard to find in other hotels in Paris. There is a jacuzzi and endless pool jets, these made the pool area rather noisy and I personally found it hard to relax. The pool was also rather cold despite being heated. There are two hammam steam rooms attached to the changing rooms, one for males and one for females. When we went there were road works going on outside and there is a motorway right outside the hotel. To combat this there are two double glazed windows between you and the noise and this worked effectively. I would recommend this hotel, although I personally on returning to Paris would look for a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Merci Beacoup”
Reviews.Author: Nibs56
Reviews.Content: Great place. The room was fairly small but the bathroom was very stylish. I have not seen that design anywhere else. The metro line 12 was very close about 5 minutes. The number 8 line looks deceptively close on the map but it is at least 15 minutes away. It goes straight to Concorde but it is not worth it. Stick to 12 for all your trips. The breakfast was included for us but it was very poor. Don't bother if you have to pay. Eat out. There is an Indian restaurant called Kamal (I think) near metro 12. It has a rickshaw outside. The hostess is very nice who speaks English, French and Hindi. High quality food. Did not feel threatened walking the streets but we were in our hotel by 10pm

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason_E_M
Reviews.Content: I have only just come back from the hotel. Although I booked it via Trip Advisor I was sceptical of the quality of the hotel and location. The hotel is VERY smart and looks incredibly modern. The rooms are all equipped with a bathroom and a seperate shower room. The shower rooms are within the bedroom but seperated by a glass panel. The lighting in the room is amazing and you can choose plenty of options. The location of the hotel isnt as bad as a few people have mentioned. It is closest to Porte de Versailles which is on the end of the Metro line 12. It takes about 15 minutes (if that) to get bang in the centre of Paris. This really isnt a problem. The area around the hotel is pleasant. The restaurants arent great and I would avoid the places which dont look too tasty. The pizza place across the road (looks just like Pizza Hut) do buy one get one free on pizza for take away!! We didnt drink at the pool bar as it was incredibly expensive..but for a 4* hotel, what do you expect? Plus, Paris is very expensive as far as capital cities go. Be very careful of the metros etc for pickpockets and suspiscious looking people. I would advise anyone to stay at Oceania. The staff and amenities and choice of breakfast is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: UkSki
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Large pool with "endless pool" jets at the end. Has great spa plus 2 hammam sauna style things. No need for a car. The velib' bikes which you can hire across paris have a station 100m away near the metro station. There is also a tram and bus. Didn't hire a car but noticed that Avis is just across the road. We found the number 80 bus better as it goes through ecole militaire (the end of the eiffel tower park), Champs Elysees and finishes quite close to Montmatre. It seemed quite quick as well. So would highly recommend taking the bus instead of the metro into town. Rooms were great, TV had french, german and British stations including BBC 1, BBC 2 and Sky News. If you want food theres a pizza restaurant and takeaway & chinese takeaway just across the road. Theres a KFC, Mcdonalds, a large supermarket and more restaurants a 10 minute walk or 1 metro stop at Convention.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stylish and great location”
Reviews.Author: mexico00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a surprise trip to Paris for a romatic weekend with my boyfriend, who booked the BA flights and this hotel on Opodo. It was my first trip to Paris and we had a fantastic time! The hotel room we had was spacious, had a comfy bed, great flat screen TV with lots of channels, including BBC1 and BBC 2. The shower is great too, but the free shampoo etc in the shower makes your hair v.dry. The curtains are amazing and make the room v.dark, so set an alarm or else you won't wake up! The pool was a bit cold, but there is a steam room that warms you up. There was some building work going on by the pool, so the route to get there was a bit strange, but all fine. Don't take your towel from your room as there are plenty down by the pool for you to use. We paid for the breakfast which was great and there was a huge variety. Staff are very helpful and speak good English. However, on the Sunday we spent the day at Disneyland Paris, and the hotel said there were no direct trains/buses from there to CDG airport, yet there was! A TVR train from the metro at Disneyland to CDG airport takes 11 minutes and was 24 euros each - a lot quicker than the 90 minute bus that stops off at all the hotels on route to the airport. The hotel itself is about 200 mts from the metro and easy to find. There are some roadworks outside the hotel, but these do not create any noise. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joolsmg
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on lastminute.com through a 'top secret' hotel deal, and were not dissapointed at all. The hotel is a little out of the way, but only 2 minutes walk from the metro - which is very fast & frequent. I think it took about 20 minutes from the centre of Paris, and less than 10 minutes from Montparnasse. Our room was a standard double, which had plenty of room - but wasn't huge. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the en-suite was fantastic with an incredibly powerful shower plus a rain shower. All were spotlessly clean. The leisure facilities are also very good. The pool is pretty small, but has counter current system for swimming. The jacuzzi and the steam room were great to relax in after spending the whole day walking. The buffet breakfast was very nice, but quite expensive at 15 euros. We had breakfast locally on our first day there - but there aren't a lot of cafes in the area. I'd recommend going into central Paris where there's a nicer atmosphere. The staff all spoke very good English, and were very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Understand Your Location”
Reviews.Author: JMoyer
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at this hotel, it is important to understand where you are staying and why. This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are very modern and clean. The amenities are very nice. The rooms are definitely superior to most others you will get at this price in Paris. The staff is friendly and speaks fluent English. So if you are you looking for some place nice to stay at where you are close to your convention with nice amenities where you can pop back and forth to the convention and have a really clean, modern room, then this is the perfect choice. However, if you are hoping to experience Paris on top of your convention, then this is not the place for you. It is in the middle of nowhere. If you plan on staying up past 11:00, forget this place. All of the cafe's nearby are closed by 11:00 and there is absolutely nothing to do. Even before 11:00 there are only limited choices. This is a convention hotel and the sidewalks, such as they are, are rolled up very early in the evening. Those cafes and restaurants you will find nearby are limited in both selections and embience. If you plan on getting up early and catching the metro downtown to see the sights and then getting back and going straight to bed, this is probably OK for you. The metro is convenient and you can get to most major sites fairly quickly. If you like the night life in any way, even just to sit at a cafe and enjoy the evening, do not stay here. There is no night life here. Everything is closed. Personally, I would not stay here again. The metro can take you to the convention center fairly quickly from a hotel further down the line and you will have far better choices for what to do when the convention ends at those places than this one. The absolute dead feeling of the area around this hotel kills off the feeling of being in Paris for me, and that far outweighs the relative moderninity of the actualy hotel. Give me a dirtier hotel in a lively area over the cleanliness of this hotel in this dead zone of Paris. But that is me. If you don't plan on staying up late, then this will probably be a good choice for you. Just be forewarned about the area. There is nothing here. Bring a book. Expect to go to sleep early. It is dull here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Stay again”
Reviews.Author: byrnesyliam
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend in Paris and used this hotel as a base, the rooms were clean, the bathrooms were really the highlight, brilliant showers and always had hot water. This hotel is in the conference section of the city and so you're not exactly central but the centre is only 5-10mins on the metro which is nice and close to the hotel. Essentially if you want a hotel next door to the Eiffel Tower this isnt it, but for the price you would pay for a very small room in a 2-3 star you get this place. One thing to remember is that this is not 5* so don't go expecting the ritz, I would say it was 3/4* in all aspects. We got a weekend breakfast included deal on lastminute.com about a month before which made it very reasonable. It was handy to know we would breakfast everyday but had we had to pay a supplement we would have opted out, as it was good but not worth the supplement price, and there are so many excellent patiserries and cafes in Paris that half the fun is discovering the place to have your next meal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful weekend in a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sken1984
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel back in November for March 13th - 16th. I chose it based on reviews and hoped for the best. Needless to say I was not disappointed. The rooms are a good size for a Parisian hotel. Bathroom and shower are fab, and there was maid service daily. The hotel staff were all exceptionally helpful, allowing me to practice my less-than-adequate French on them and speaking in English if I requested. We got a deal with the Buffet Breakfast included, and that was lovely. I expected having to get up super early to avoid the rush before all the food was gone, but the choice was great and the food was bountiful irregarless of what time we went (between 7-10am). It buffet included Bread, croissant and pain-au-chocolat, selection of cold meats, hot bacon, eggs, sausages, fruit salad, fruits, yoghurts freshly squeezed juices, cheese and spreads, and lots of variations of coffees and teas and more. The area itself is quite nice. Porte de Versaille is in the South of Paris (get the dark-green Line 12). Any Irish passengers travelling with Ryan Air to Beauvais are dropped by bus to Porte Maillot in the West of the city. It's just a matter of walking around the shopping centre immediately infront of the bus depot, getting the yellow line, changing at Concorde and down to Porte de Versaille. There's quite a few Restaurants nearby, some better than others but that's up to personal taste. The hotel is pretty visible when you surface from the metro line. It's a particularly nice area. Walking along the street to the left of the hotel's entrance, there are plenty of shops (usually open until 8), bakeries and more restaurants. There's aso a vibrant market that sells local produce and clothing etc. We bought snacks and wine and spirits in one shop in particular and saved an absolute fortune. We brought it for a picnic in the Trocadero Gardens while taking a break from strolling around the city. I wouldn't recommend the bar in the hotel, not because it has a bad atmosphere, but because it's ridiculously expensive (12euro for a Jack Daniels). All in all a fabulous weekend, and to top it all off, my boyfriend proposed!

Reviews.Title: “All great, except staff”
Reviews.Author: evw89
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on ratestogo.com a week before we left and got a very food price for this 4* hotel. We arrived very late due to a delayed flight so we got a taxi from Charles de Gaulles airport which cost us 50 euros. We had some trouble with our hotel room - we got moved as our TV didn't work, then got given a key that didn't work - and the staff were overall quite rude and unhelpful regarding this. The rooms however were lovely - modern furniture, the comfiest bed I have ever slept on in a hotel, a great shower and they were kept extremely clean. The TV is a plasma and has plenty of channels and radio stations. The location is great - a 20 minute journey (5 min walk, 15 mins metro) into the centre of Paris, and quiet. Even though it is on a main road, the double glazing blocks out all sound from the outside. We never ate breakfast at the hotel due to the price but instead found small cafés in Paris to eat. The pool in the hotel is a lovely heated pool with a large jacuzzi and we found it perfect for relaxing after a long day navigating Paris via the metro (which is very well set out and very easy to use) Overall I would recommend this hotel for it's location, rooms and facilities (although the bar was overpriced), but be prepared for unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: DishGagan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this excellent hotel for three nights and found it to of a very high standard. The trip by taxi from gard de nord (came by eurostar) to the hotel cost 25 euros and too about 20mins through rush hour traffic, be warned, the paris taxi drivers will try and fleece you so be warned. Could have got the tube to the hotel but didn't want to carry my luggage in the tube. The hotels room are as shown and are very comfortable and clean and are cleaned to a good standard. th TV channels are plenty and enough to keep everyone entertained. The tube system is easy to use and the nearest metro station is only a few minutes up the road and easy to get to. The only downside of the hotel is the breakfast, its absolutely horrible and a complete rip off at 15euros each, there is plenty of places to eat near by and there is a Mcdonalds about 10mins on the left of the hotel. Otherwise a fantastic hotel and easy to get to see the sights of paris via the metro system...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, fab rooms.”
Reviews.Author: teddycody
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June, found it really easy to get around from here by car or metro, the rooms were quiet even though it was close to the ring road and the facilities in the hotel were great if you were there for the sightseeing,

Reviews.Title: “Wounderfull hotel in paris outskirt”
Reviews.Author: shiki
Reviews.Content: we (my girlfriend and I) have just returned from 8 lovely days in paris. the vacation was wonderfull, and we will no doubt return to paris. in the first 5 nights we stayed in apartment at the Marea quarter, and the last 2 nights we stayed at the Oceania hotel. we booked those 2 nights by using the website www.ratestogo.com, the final price was 220 euro for one night (double room). now for the impression from the hotel: Location - it is about 15 min from the city center (metro station "Concord"). it is ok, especially if you do it twice a day (going out in the morning, getting back at night). Staff - all the staff talk english. they were friendly and willing to help us. we left our luggages on the chek-in day (we came at 12:00 and the room wasn't ready), and on the chek-out day (we had flight only at midnight, so we left the luggages till 20:00). room - very clean, everything is new and well decorated. the shower is excellent and very big. king size bed. double windows so no noise from outside. A/C. facilities - since it was our first visit in paris, we didn't had the time to enjoy the spa, pool and Jacuzzi. so, as summary - it is not cheap, but my G.F and I were very glad to come back and to know that we will have a pleasent shower and good sleep. so we think that this place worth the money that we paid for. how to get there? take the metro line 12 to "mairie d'issy", get down at station "porte de versailles", find the exit (sortie in French) "... sport" (i don't remember teh full name of it). now as you are going up the stairs, continue a head about 200 meter. you will get to small road junction and the hotel is just there infront of you. enjoy all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, near Metro with bar,pool, gym and parking”
Reviews.Author: mgibbons
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids loved this hotel. We'd originally stayed at the Classic which is just around the corner but they didn't like the lack of a communal area which, coupled with the fact that the hotel is on the outskirts of Paris and so lacking the wealth of local nightlife, prompted us to move. When I showed them this one they just loved it. The rooms are not large - but that is common for all the Parisien hotels - but it is very modern, clean and quiet (the windows are quadruple glazed!). The basement has a large bar area from which you can watch the kids in the pool. We got a fantastic deal through ratestogo.com (140 euro's per night) however even if you paid the full price of 285 euro's I still think you'd be satisfied. The breakfast - although pricey at 15 euro's - was very good and the service excellent. There's good parking undeneath the hotel at 15 euro's per day. We ate at the Italian restaurant just around the corner (turn right out of the entrance and around 100 yards on the right) on three out of the four nights we were there. Highly recommended by all of us.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Oceania Paris Porte de Versailles
HotelInfo.Address: 52 Rue d'Oradour-sur-Glane | 15th Arr., 75015 Paris, France
